newsitem.title: FRANCE: Euro-court takes up Iranian vs Britain case.
newsitem.headline: Euro-court takes up Iranian vs Britain case.

text.p: The European Commission of Human Rights on Friday took up a bid by a convicted Iranian drug dealer to avoid being deported from Britain.

The commission said the unnamed man, who backed Iran's Mujahideen rebels and enjoys refugee status in Britain, argued that if sent home he could face ill-treatment in violation of the European Convention of Human Rights.
The man was jailed for 10 years in 1988 for supplying heroin with a recommendation that he be deported after serving out his term.

He was paroled in 1993 and held again pending expulsion. The Immigration Appeals Tribunal rejected his appeal against deportation, saying the danger he posed in Britain outweighed the risks he ran by returning to Iran.

The Commission said it would refer the case to the Committee of Ministers of the Council of Europe, unless there was an amicable settlement between the Iranian and British governments or one of the two sides took the case to the European Court of Human Rights.
The Commission acts as the court's screening body.
